about.name: Ruben Cristea

about.description: Architecting High-Scale Systems & Intelligent Platforms. Transforming complex legacy challenges into streamlined, modular infrastructure.

resume.title: Experience
resume.summary: Driven software engineer with 5+ years of experience, crafting high-performance applications and tackling complex code infrastructure solutions. Skilled at architecture, implementation, testing, and maintenance of software solutions.

ncr-voyix-lead.bullet1: Led team of engineers for a cutting edge AI-driven, point-of-sale platform targeting SMB to enterprise. Architected and implemented the frontend architecture for a configuration-driven renderer that dynamically composes UI at runtime.
ncr-voyix-lead.bullet2: Recruited and onboarded a high performing engineering team, coordinated technical direction with backend, product, and UX, ran engineering planning and story distribution, and demoed progress to C-suite stakeholders.
ncr-voyix-lead.bullet3: Built a proof-of-concept drag-and-drop editor to validate the builder UX before full implementation and defined the layout/rendering engine. Awarded an equity grant by the CTO in recognition of leadership and impact.

ncr-voyix.bullet1: Spearheaded the investigation and development of a groundbreaking cloud platform architecture featuring a modular federation micro frontend web platform designed to power both new and legacy applications.
ncr-voyix.bullet2: Paved the way for a unified development ecosystem to streamline operations and foster collaboration across teams at NCR using the platform I developed.
ncr-voyix.bullet3: Developed a microservice-based back office management application using React, NestJS, and TypeScript. Ensured scalability and adaptability, exceeding project objectives.

ibm-weather.company: IBM | The Weather Company · Atlanta, GA
ibm-weather.bullet1: Developed high-performance, data-driven user interfaces for web applications, using modern frameworks to ensure robust data integrity and efficient asynchronous operations.
ibm-weather.bullet2: Executed the migration of critical web infrastructure from IBM Cloud to AWS, enhanced system scalability and resilience allowing for a 50% increase in maximum requests per second.
ibm-weather.bullet3: Engineered and optimized cron jobs for critical tasks, reducing radar generation tasks by 90%. Led the development of POC for an upcoming TV app, unlocking new business avenues.

talitrix.bullet1: Developed and maintained a mission-critical location data infrastructure at Talitrix, ensuring the safety of victims by accurately tracking and monitoring high-risk individuals through rigorous data management.
talitrix.bullet2: Designed and implemented algorithms that processed and analyzed location data from hardware devices, producing real-time compliance and violation data for electronic monitoring applications.
talitrix.bullet3: Engineered a robust backend system utilizing Django, Django REST Framework, and PostgreSQL to process high-volume location data, implementing complex algorithms for curfews and exclusion zones.

carcareers.bullet1: Architected scalable solutions, including algorithms and system designs, within a monorepo structure (React frontend, NestJS backend), to meet evolving business requirements.
carcareers.bullet2: Engineered software solutions throughout the full development lifecycle, adhering to company standards, utilizing a monorepo structure and deploying to GKE.
carcareers.bullet3: Led a team of engineers and designers in the development of a new phase of the platform, significantly enhancing scalability and user experience for nationwide expansion.

uga-gavel.company: University of Georgia - GAVEL Lab · Athens, GA
uga-gavel.bullet1: Part-time role at UGA's Games and Virtual Environments Lab. Designed and created virtual environments using Unity and C# outlined by researchers to better understand how virtual environments influence people.
uga-gavel.bullet2: Created environments to test HP Reverb G2 Omnicept Edition face and eye tracking technology to explore new possibilities for future research projects.
uga-gavel.bullet3: Collaborated with research teams to build immersive VR experiences for academic studies on human perception and behavior in virtual environments.
